work.name: Technesthai
work.summary: Some random text about my job. Just add some text to make it longer.
highlights: I develop using Vue.js with Vuetify, and C# with .NET and Entity Framework, alongside PostgreSQL.
I oversee IT activities, define priorities and deadlines, draft specification definitions and estimations.
I manage infrastructure, handle DevOps activities, deploy software via GitLab pipelines, and maintain the company’s GitLab instance.
I manage recruitment and mentor junior staff

work.name: IasonLtd
work.summary: Managed and led IT and consulting teams in financial industry.
highlights: As a **Manager**, I led an eight-person IT team, overseeing budgeting, recruitment, and project deadlines. I executed the migration of a legacy ATS (Applicant Tracking System) application to Vue.js and Vuetify, enhancing its functionality and user experience. Additionally, I developed new features to streamline HR processes, closely collaborating with the product manager to meet evolving business needs and improve overall efficiency.

As a **Senior Consultant**, I led two teams in Counterparty Credit Risk (CCR) and Market Data. I focused on SA-CCR and FRTB KPI GUI refactoring, implemented features end-to-end, and mentored junior team members.

As a **Consultant**, I led a four-person team, prioritized tasks, and managed team economics. I implemented updates to the CCR application to meet regulatory requirements and served as a functional analyst for SA-CCR.
As a **Junior Consultant**, I worked as a Financial Engineer, enhancing the CCR application, fixing bugs, and improving internal tools. I specialized in CCR exposure calculation.

projects.name: PodCats
projects.description: Developed a cat-themed podcast manager using Vue.js 3 and Vuetify 3 for the frontend, with a GoLang backend. The app features podcast playback, **multi-user support**, **RSS feed import**, **automatic feed updates** via cron jobs, and **universal search**. Tech stack includes Vue.js, howler.js, marked, gin-gonic, gorm, viper, and SQLite. Deployable with Docker.

projects.name: HomeLab
projects.description: I started my HomeLab by chance with a Raspberry Pi and the almighty [Pi-Hole](https://pi-hole.net/), and now I'm totally down the rabbit hole. It's addictive! I've since expanded to managing a [Proxmox](https://www.proxmox.com/en/) node, complete with a dedicated [pfSense](https://www.pfsense.org/) virtual machine serving as my home firewall. The complexity keeps growing, but so does the excitement!
